intro: Tetrastigma tavoyanum, commonly known as the Tavoyan crossvine, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by small, fleshy berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural and ecological studies.
